description:
Albania, Tirana, January 11th.
Prime Minister and the Minister of Health and Social Protection announced: 
Vaccination against COVID19 starts in Albania, the first doses are provided by Pfizer.
All health workers, ie doctors, nurses who provide services in the Covid hospitals will be the first to be vaccinated. The vaccination will be carried at the national stadium 'Air Albania'.
The Albanian government has provided 500 thousand doses of vaccine from Pfizer.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_vac_purchase: Preorder with the option of expanding the order
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
By October 2, 2020, "Republic of Kosovo" and "Republic of Albania" have signed a cooperation agreement in the field of health.
"This agreement will further deepen not only the cooperation but also the mutual exchange of experts and health personnel in order to support and clinical case management. Cooperation in the field of providing good medical practice and evidence for the treatment of patients with Covid19. Provision of health and public health services by doctors of both countries for border areas. Establishment of a common platform for information sharing in the context of epidemic surveillance. "Also, reciprocal actions in the framework of the epidemiological investigation, exchange of information for the citizens in both countries, of the cross-border areas, and mutual measures which will continue to be taken following the response to Covid19",
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: Albanian government has decided from 20 September 2020 to "Prohibits the opening of nightclubs, discos, lounge bars and any kind of service of this nature indoors or outdoors, except restaurants." Those who breaks the law will be fined with 3.000.000 lek (29000 USD) and "suspension of activity for a period of one year." Moreover, there will be the stop of the "music after 20.00 (8.00 pm) in all service facilities of any kind". Those who breaks the law will be fined with 1.000.000 lek (9700 USD) and "suspension of activity for a period of six months."
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential
institution_status: This type of business ("Restaurants") is allowed to open with no conditions attached
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: From 11 november "there will be restrictions on movement from 22:00-6:00 until December 2. Exceptions are emergencies and reasons for work." Moreover, "there will be a restriction on fast food restaurants and bars from 22:00 to 6:00 in addition to the delivery service until December 2nd. Citizens will be provided with authorization in e-albania, except in cases when there are health emergencies or for health institutions and employees of critical services that are excluded from applying in e-Albania."
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
institution_cat: No information in the policy about whether the business is considered essential or non-essential
institution_status: This type of business  ("Restaurants") is closed/locked down

description: Albania extended the ban on public gatherings that was set on March 8th indefinitely.
Albania extended the ban on public gatherings that was set on March 8th indefinitely. UPDATE: The government extended the ban on all public gatherings indefinitely.

description: "The Albanian government" has decreed, on a national basis, "the mandatory use of protective fabric masks" in "every closed environment". The decree, imposed on all citizens, entered into force on July 15 and with a deadline to be set and a "penalty of 2,000 lek (20 USD) for each violation of the rule".
